RegEx is one of the most useful parts of Python in my opinion and as a biochemistry major, it is very handy for manipulating DNA sequences. Using reticulate to combine both R and Python, we can see that the RegEx can find instances of a sequence in a longer sequence and this can be helpful to locate the sequences digested by restiction enzymes.

```{r}
library(reticulate)
```


```{python}
import re

string5=""

re.findall(r"A[ATCG]TAAT|GC[AG][AT]TG", string5)
```
